alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Cobb; Floyd; Paulding; Polk (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 7:44PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Paulding, northwestern Cobb, southeastern Floyd, northeastern Polk and southern Bartow Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 744 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Lindale to near Taylorsville to Braswell, and moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Cartersville, Kennesaw, Acworth, Euharlee, Emerson, Kingston, Taylorsville, Cassville, Burnt Hickory Ridge, Red Top Mountain State Park, Cross Roads, Due West, Stilesboro and New Hope. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for north central and northwestern Georgia.
